full_summary:
**Natural Bridge and Dog Lake Bridge Rehabilitation Tenders**

**Notice: Invitation to Qualify**

Parks Canada invites interested bidders to submit their qualifications for the rehabilitation of two Class A Pedestrian Trail bridges: Natural Bridge, Yoho National Park (YNP) and Dog Lake Bridge, Kootenay National Park (KNP).

**Purpose:**
The objective of this tender is to provide rehabilitation services for the above-mentioned bridges. Work includes concrete crack repair, concrete patch repair, concrete pin installation and repair, and approach re-grading.

**Project Details:**

*   Estimated value: $100,001 - $250,000 (inclusive of taxes)
*   Project duration: Approximately three months
*   Completion date: September 30, 2024

**Requirements and Instructions:**

Please refer to the solicitation document for comprehensive information on bid submission, evaluation criteria, and contact details.

**Important Notes:**

*   Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
*   Bidders are required to submit their bids via fax or email only. Submissions received in person or by courier will not be accepted.
*   The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
*   Enquiries of a technical and contractual nature must be submitted to the Contracting Authority in writing.
*   Please note that National Parks Regulations require all work to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

**Bid Submission and Evaluation:**

This is a two-stage selection process. In the first stage, bidders will be evaluated based on their qualifications. Shortlisted bidders will then be invited to submit a financial bid in the second stage.

**Prospects:**

Prospective bidders are encouraged to review the solicitation document for detailed information on the project requirements and submission guidelines.

**Contact Information:**

For technical and contractual inquiries, please contact Alison Guilford at (204) 390-7234 or by email at alison.guilford@pc.gc.ca.

**Language of Bid:**
Bidders may submit their bids in either official language of Canada.

**Solicitation Documents:**

Solicitation documents are available on the Government of Canada tendering service at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

I hope this rewritten entry meets your expectations! Let me know if you have any further queries or require any additional support.
